greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Numerator of Sum_{k=1..n} (-1)^(k+1)/k^2.
comment: p divides a(p-1) for prime p > 2 -- similar to Wolstenholme's theorem for A007406(n) (numerator of Sum_{k=1..n} 1/k^2).
link: Muniru A Asiru, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..240
mathematica: a[n_] := 1/12 (Pi^2 - 3 (-1)^n Zeta[2, (1 + n)/2, IncludeSingularTerm -> False] + 3 (-1)^n Zeta[2, 1 + n/2, IncludeSingularTerm -> False]) // Simplify // Numerator
program: (PARI) first(n) = {my(res = vector(n), s = 1); res[1] = 1; for(k = 2, n, s = -s; res[k] = res[k - 1] + s/k^2; res[k - 1] = numerator(res[k - 1])); res} \\ _David A. Corneth_, Apr 07 2018
results.author: _Alexander Adamchuk_, Jun 08 2006, Jun 25 2006
